leadingComments.value: remove the file extension from the file path:

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Define aliases
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-alias
	 * @param {object} aliases The alias specifications
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .alias({
	 *     'react': 'inferno-compat',
	 *     'react-dom': 'inferno-compat',
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Define aliases
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-alias
	 * @param {object} aliases The alias specifications
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .alias({
	 *     'react': 'inferno-compat',
	 *     'react-dom': 'inferno-compat',
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Returns a plain JavaScript object representing the built Webpack configuration
	 * @return {object}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Returns a plain JavaScript object representing the built Webpack configuration
	 * @return {object}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Set the output directory
	 * @param {string} dir The output directory; this path may be relative or absolute
	 * @param {boolean} chunkhash=true Whether to include [chunkhash] in the filename
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .dest('build/public/js', false)
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Set the output directory
	 * @param {string} dir The output directory; this path may be relative or absolute
	 * @param {boolean} chunkhash=true Whether to include [chunkhash] in the filename
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .dest('build/public/js', false)
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Specify whether or not to generate development configuration
	 * @param {boolean} enable Whether or not to enable development mode
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .development((process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development') == 'development')
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Specify whether or not to generate development configuration
	 * @param {boolean} enable Whether or not to enable development mode
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .development((process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development') == 'development')
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Turns on overlay and optional proxy
	 * @param {Object} opts (plus optional 'proxy' options to be passed to 'http-proxy')
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .devServer({
	 *     publicPath: '/js/',
	 *     proxy: {
	 *       target: 'https://localhost:8443/',
	 *       secure: false,
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Turns on overlay and optional proxy
	 * @param {Object} opts (plus optional 'proxy' options to be passed to 'http-proxy')
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .devServer({
	 *     publicPath: '/js/',
	 *     proxy: {
	 *       target: 'https://localhost:8443/',
	 *       secure: false,
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Add resolvable extensions (ex: '.jsx', '.css')
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-extensions
	 * @param {...string} ext The extensions to add
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .extensions('.js', '.jsx', '.ts', '.css', '.less', '.scss')
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Add resolvable extensions (ex: '.jsx', '.css')
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-extensions
	 * @param {...string} ext The extensions to add
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .extensions('.js', '.jsx', '.ts', '.css', '.less', '.scss')
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Add a loader
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/module/#module-rules
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} ext The file extensions to match
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} loader The loader spec
	 * @param {?object} query The loader parameters
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .loader(['.js', '.jsx'], 'babel-loader', {
	 *     presets: ['latest', 'react'],
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Add a loader
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/module/#module-rules
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} ext The file extensions to match
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} loader The loader spec
	 * @param {?object} query The loader parameters
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .loader(['.js', '.jsx'], 'babel-loader', {
	 *     presets: ['latest', 'react'],
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Merge configuration using `webpack-merge`
	 * @see https://github.com/survivejs/webpack-merge
	 * @param {...object} cfgs The configurations to merge
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .merge({
	 *     resolve: {
	 *       modules: ['node_modules'],
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*
	 * Merge configuration using `webpack-merge`
	 * @see https://github.com/survivejs/webpack-merge
	 * @param {...object} cfgs The configurations to merge

	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .merge({
	 *     resolve: {
	 *       modules: ['node_modules'],
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .plugins(new Plugin1(), new Plugin2())
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Specify whether or not to generate production configuration
	 * @param {boolean} enable Whether or not to enable production mode
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .production(process.env.NODE_ENV == 'production')
	 *   .build()

	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .production(process.env.NODE_ENV == 'production')
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Set entry/entries based on glob(s)
	 * @param {...string} globs The file globs
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .src('src/*.js')
	 *   .build()

	 * @param {...string} globs The file globs

	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .src('src/*.js')
	 *   .build()

trailingComments.value:
*
	 * Specify vendor modules
	 * @param {...string} modules The vendor modules
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .vendor('react', 'react-dom', ...)
	 *   .build()

leadingComments.value:
*

	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .vendor('react', 'react-dom', ...)

comments.value: remove the file extension from the file path:

*
	 * Define aliases
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-alias
	 * @param {object} aliases The alias specifications
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .alias({
	 *     'react': 'inferno-compat',
	 *     'react-dom': 'inferno-compat',
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Returns a plain JavaScript object representing the built Webpack configuration
	 * @return {object}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Set the output directory
	 * @param {string} dir The output directory; this path may be relative or absolute
	 * @param {boolean} chunkhash=true Whether to include [chunkhash] in the filename
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .dest('build/public/js', false)
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Specify whether or not to generate development configuration
	 * @param {boolean} enable Whether or not to enable development mode
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .development((process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development') == 'development')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Turns on overlay and optional proxy
	 * @param {Object} opts (plus optional 'proxy' options to be passed to 'http-proxy')
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .devServer({
	 *     publicPath: '/js/',
	 *     proxy: {
	 *       target: 'https://localhost:8443/',
	 *       secure: false,
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Add resolvable extensions (ex: '.jsx', '.css')
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-extensions
	 * @param {...string} ext The extensions to add
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .extensions('.js', '.jsx', '.ts', '.css', '.less', '.scss')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Add a loader
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/module/#module-rules
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} ext The file extensions to match
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} loader The loader spec
	 * @param {?object} query The loader parameters
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .loader(['.js', '.jsx'], 'babel-loader', {
	 *     presets: ['latest', 'react'],
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Merge configuration using `webpack-merge`
	 * @see https://github.com/survivejs/webpack-merge
	 * @param {...object} cfgs The configurations to merge
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .merge({
	 *     resolve: {
	 *       modules: ['node_modules'],
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Add plugins
	 * @param {...object} plugins The plugins to add
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .plugins(new Plugin1(), new Plugin2())
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Specify whether or not to generate production configuration
	 * @param {boolean} enable Whether or not to enable production mode
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .production(process.env.NODE_ENV == 'production')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Set entry/entries based on glob(s)
	 * @param {...string} globs The file globs
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .src('src/*.js')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Specify vendor modules
	 * @param {...string} modules The vendor modules
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .vendor('react', 'react-dom', ...)
	 *   .build()

tokens.value: remove the file extension from the file path:

*
	 * Define aliases
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-alias
	 * @param {object} aliases The alias specifications
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .alias({
	 *     'react': 'inferno-compat',
	 *     'react-dom': 'inferno-compat',
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Returns a plain JavaScript object representing the built Webpack configuration
	 * @return {object}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Set the output directory
	 * @param {string} dir The output directory; this path may be relative or absolute
	 * @param {boolean} chunkhash=true Whether to include [chunkhash] in the filename
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .dest('build/public/js', false)
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Specify whether or not to generate development configuration
	 * @param {boolean} enable Whether or not to enable development mode
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .development((process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development') == 'development')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Turns on overlay and optional proxy
	 * @param {Object} opts (plus optional 'proxy' options to be passed to 'http-proxy')
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .devServer({
	 *     publicPath: '/js/',
	 *     proxy: {
	 *       target: 'https://localhost:8443/',
	 *       secure: false,
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Add resolvable extensions (ex: '.jsx', '.css')
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-extensions
	 * @param {...string} ext The extensions to add
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .extensions('.js', '.jsx', '.ts', '.css', '.less', '.scss')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Add a loader
	 * @see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/module/#module-rules
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} ext The file extensions to match
	 * @param {string|Array<string>} loader The loader spec
	 * @param {?object} query The loader parameters
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .loader(['.js', '.jsx'], 'babel-loader', {
	 *     presets: ['latest', 'react'],
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Merge configuration using `webpack-merge`
	 * @see https://github.com/survivejs/webpack-merge
	 * @param {...object} cfgs The configurations to merge
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .merge({
	 *     resolve: {
	 *       modules: ['node_modules'],
	 *     },
	 *   })
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Add plugins
	 * @param {...object} plugins The plugins to add
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .plugins(new Plugin1(), new Plugin2())
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Specify whether or not to generate production configuration
	 * @param {boolean} enable Whether or not to enable production mode
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .production(process.env.NODE_ENV == 'production')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Set entry/entries based on glob(s)
	 * @param {...string} globs The file globs
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .src('src/*.js')
	 *   .build()

*
	 * Specify vendor modules
	 * @param {...string} modules The vendor modules
	 * @return {ConfigurationBuilder}
	 * @example
	 * // webpack.config.js
	 * module.exports = builder()
	 *   .vendor('react', 'react-dom', ...)
	 *   .build()
